children.subject:
Yes, you should enroll into 16A in Spring 2022. 

It might not be a very good idea to take EECS 16A and EECS 16B together if you do not have a strong circuits background. EECS 16B jumps right into circuits while EECS 16A starts their intro to circuits material around the 5th week. 

As for your enrollment in EECS 16B, the department is working on planning to offer the course for Summer 2022, however it is not a guarantee. You can consider taking the course then. If you wait for a future semester, you can still take the course, but you will not have priority registration - meaning you will be placed on the waitlist and be moved into the course during the adjustment period if there is still space. Fall 2022 is also a good time to try and take EECS 16B as it's going against the order of the sequence (typically students take EECS 16A fall and then EECS 16B during the spring). If you waitlist 16B for Fall 2022, be sure to do so during Phase I of enrollment for Fall 2022 enrollment.
Thank you for the clarification. I am still not sure how waitlist and phases work... Even if I sign up for 16B my junior year fall in Phase 1, I am still automatically put on the waitlist?
Correct, you will be placed on the waitlist.
I am a sophomore who never took EE16A. Should I sign up for EE16A next semester, and take 16B in summer/Fall 2022? Will I still get the course then? Or do I take 16A and 16B together next semester?

We advise students to always waitlist the class during Phase I of enrollment. If the class is offered over the summer, we encourage students to sign up. If a student is concerned about this and is close to gradating they can contact their major advisor for further advise.
Does this mean there will be no accommodation for the situation mentioned by anon. comp?

Unless a student qualifies for one the reserved categories. If they do not they will be placed on the waitlist. Any student who needs 16B to graduate should waitlist 16B in Phase I to increases their chances on getting in.

To clarify, if juniors phase 1 this class every semester until they graduate and never get off the waitlist, the department cannot guarantee that the juniors will be able to take the class or make accommodations for them to take it?

I've already taken the class but I'm curious about the answer.

While I believe saying it isn't useful can be harsh, I do sympathize with scale. I actually do look forward to many parts of 16b, but as someone who enjoys software a lot, I feel like forcing 16b into my schedule hampered my plans a lot(as it is a heavy workload class requiring low workload complements with it) and made me push things I felt I could use earlier to later when I felt that 16b is a great junior year class to allow for senior year EE or 189

This is a bad policy. If the department has enough seats for everyone to take 16B, students should be able to choose which semester to take it without fearmongering about not being able to graduate. If there are not enough seats, the department should accept another class in lieu of 16B (127? 189?). It's not like 16B is a valuable class for most people taking it anyway — we take it only because it's required, and a substantial number of students choose to delay taking it because it's not very useful.
I highly recommend making adjustments to your schedule if possible to accommodate 16B. Seats are not held for juniors & seniors.
I'm a current sophomore who had concerns over not being able to fit 16b into my schedule for the spring. If I phase 1 it for fall 2022 or fall 2023 with regents priority, would I be able to get in?
Precisely. I even spoke to a major advisor about taking 16B in junior year, and they said I'm good to go. Now I'm being told I may be ineligible for CS. This seems rather unfair.

I was really concerned about this policy in the past few days... It is so short notice, and I never knew that we had to take the EE series before the end of sophomore year. I have been prioritizing 61a, b, and 70 so I can declare, but never knew that even if I were declared, not having taken the 16 series would make me ineligible for CS major...
Please review the reserved categories for Fall 2021. Fall 2022 categories may be similar.

I am seeking clarification on this policy as a new CS transfer student.

I am planning to take EECS16A in Spring 2022 and EECS16B in Fall 2022. As a transfer student, will I have priority to enroll in EECS16B in Fall 2022?
I am very rusty on my Linear Algebra and have never done circuits, so I would like to take EECS16A first so I can get the most out of EECS16B.

Hi I'm a sophomore student in another college currently taking CS61B and CS70 so I'm trying to declare a simultaneous degree in CS. I haven't taken EECS 16B but I have taken a linear algebra course so I plan to enroll in 16B in spring 2022. However since I haven't declared CS and I'm still in another college, I won't have reserved seats. Should I just add myself to the waitlist in Phase I and hope that I could get in?

I'm currently an undeclared, intended CS major (sophomore) who took 16a last semester. I phase 1-ed 16b for Spring 2022, but I was put on the waitlist, so should I expect to be taken off eventually, since faculty wants all students to finish 16b by sophomore year?

I’m currently waitlisted for EECS 16b even though it has reserved spots for Sophomores. I think it might have to do with taking a gap year but I don’t think that should actually make me a Junior. Is there anything you can do to help me?

history.content:
Updated: 10/15/2021. Please review the corrections below.

Dear EECS, L&S CS, and prospective L&S CS students,

I am posting this message on behalf of the EECS Department regarding EECS 16B. Students who are Terms 3-4 and who have not taken EECS 16B should add themselves to the class during Phase I. There is no guarantee that space will be available if you wait until Phase II. EECS 16B is a high demand course.

Our long-standing enrollment policy is that we do not hold seats for juniors and seniors (with the exception of transfer students). Therefore, if you plan to graduate with a CS or EECS major, do not wait, or you may delay your graduation.

For students with Expected Graduation Terms (EGT) of Spring 2022, Fall 2022, Spring 2023, or Fall 2023 who have not taken EECS 16B, it is important to add yourself to the waitlist in Phase I. There is no guarantee that you will get in, but waitlisting the class in Phase I increases your chances of getting into the course if space becomes available.

Anyone who waits until Phase II to add/waitlist 16B will have a much lower chance of adding the class.

*Correction: EECS transfers and CS intended transfer students should take 16B as soon as possible. We highly recommend 16A before 16B.

If you have an EECS 16B enrollment question, email ee-scheduling@berkeley.edu.

* Review the 16B Enrollment FAQs here: https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/faqs/EECS16B-enrollment
*Getting into EE Classes (long standing policy): https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/faqs/getting-into-ee-classes
______________________________
The previous message below has been amended to the message above.

Dear EECS, L&S CS, and prospective L&S CS students,

I am posting this message on behalf of the EECS Department regarding EECS 16B. Students who are Terms 3-4 and who have not taken EECS 16B should add themselves to the class during Phase I. There is no guarantee that space will be available if you wait until Phase II. EECS 16B is a high demand course.

Our long-standing enrollment policy is that we do not hold seats for juniors and seniors (with the exception of transfer students). Therefore, if you plan to graduate with a CS or EECS major, do not wait, or you may delay your graduation.

For students with Expected Graduation Terms (EGT) of Spring 2022, Fall 2022, Spring 2023, or Fall 2023 who have not taken EECS 16B, it is important to add yourself to the waitlist in Phase I. There is no guarantee that you will get in, but waitlisting the class in Phase I increases your chances of getting into the course if space becomes available.

Anyone who waits until Phase II to add/waitlist 16B will have a much lower chance of adding the class.

Special rules for transfer students - EECS transfer students should take 16B the semester after they complete 16A. CS transfer students might want to wait until they declare the major.

If you have an EECS 16B enrollment question, email ee-scheduling@eecs.berkeley.edu.

* Review the 16B Enrollment FAQs here: https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/faqs/EECS16B-enrollment
*Getting into EE Classes (long standing policy): https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/faqs/getting-into-ee-classes
